content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
# Find all code blocks using julia language syntax
julia_blocks = findall(/(\bjulia:?:\s*[^#]*)$/, md, "g")

# Remove code fences (if any) from the code blocks
cleaned_blocks = map(block => block.replace("/*", ""), julia_blocks)

# Join the cleaned code blocks together with a newline
result = join(map(join(cleaned_blocks), splitat(concatenate(cleaned_blocks, "\n\n"))))

return result
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to find all the julia language code blocks in the input `md` string. It then removes any code fences (indicated by `/*`) from each block using a map comprehension. Finally, it joins the cleaned code blocks together with a newline and returns the result as a String.
